Package Controller

Class DataCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.DataCheck

extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods for checking the data throughout the program run.

      • isBetween

        public static void isBetween​(java.lang.Integer inventory,
                             java.lang.Integer min,
                             java.lang.Integer max)
        This method checks that data entered is between two values
        Parameters:
        inventory - the data the user enters
        min - The low-end value to check the data against
        max - The high-end value to check the data against

      • hasParts

        public static boolean hasParts​(Product product,
                               Part part)
        This method checks to make sure the product data that is passed has/doesn't have the passed product.
        Parameters:
        product - The product to check its associated parts
        part - The part to check agains the product's associated parts list.
        Returns:
        Returns T if the part already exists, F if it doesn't

      • minMax

        public static void minMax​(java.lang.Integer min,
                          java.lang.Integer max)
        This method makes sure the user-entered Min value is less than the Max value (and vice versa)
        Parameters:
        min - The passed min value to check
        max - The passed max value to check

      • intOrString

        public static boolean intOrString​(java.lang.String input)
        This Method is here to check if the input is an int value
        Parameters:
        input - This holds the input value to check if the data is an integer type or string type
        Returns:
        Returns T if the input is of Int type, F if it is String (or not Int)

      • isNotNegative

        public static void isNotNegative​(int input,
                                 java.lang.String type)
        This method will check the input data to make sure it isn't a 0 or a negative number
        Parameters:
        input - The user input to check if it is of a negative value
        type - The type of error depending on which window it is called from

      • isInteger

        public static void isInteger​(java.lang.String input)
        This method is used to verify that the data input is of integer type
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to validate if it is of Int type

      • isDouble

        public static void isDouble​(java.lang.String input)
        This method confirms that the input data is of Double type
        Parameters:
        input - The input in string form to convert/test

      • isDuplicate

        public static boolean isDuplicate​(int input)
        This method is used to make sure the PartIDs are not duplicated
        Parameters:
        input - The id of the part that is passed in to check if it's id already exists.
        Returns:
        Returns T if it is a Duplicate, F if it isn't

      • isZero

        public static void isZero​(java.lang.Double cost)
        This method makes sure the input data for Cost isn't 0
        Parameters:
        cost - The input Cost of a part or product

      • hasData

        public static void hasData​(java.lang.String dataCheck,
                           java.lang.String type)
        This method makes sure the input has data
        Parameters:
        dataCheck - The data being passed in to verify if it has any data or not
        type - the type of data being passed in.

      • popupWindow

        public static void popupWindow​(java.lang.String input,
                               java.lang.String message,
                               java.lang.String title)
        This is the method constructor for the generic popup window used throughout the code.
        Parameters:
        input - This is the data in question for the popup window to display
        message - This is the message for the popup window to display
        title - This is the title of the popup window.

      • generateID

        public static int generateID()
        This method is used to generate unique IDs for the parts and products.
        Returns:
